sentences.sContent: Not only is there no God, but try getting a plumber on weekends.
sentences.sContent_eng: Not only is there no God, but try getting a plumber on weekends.
sentences.sCn: 不仅上帝不存在，而且周末连一个水管工都找不到。

sentences.sContent: At the age of 74, he is still going strong as the oldest plumber in business in Boise, Idaho.
sentences.sContent_eng: At the age of 74, he is still going strong as the oldest plumber in business in Boise, Idaho.
sentences.sCn: 尽管他已经74岁高龄，但身体依然很健壮，是爱达荷州博伊西商界中最老的水管工。

sentences.sContent: Even without a high-school diploma, a black man can probably find a job if he looks. And some manual jobs, such as plumber or cable technician, pay quite well.
sentences.sContent_eng: Even without a high-school diploma, a black man can probably find a job if he looks. And some manual jobs, such as plumber or cable technician, pay quite well.
sentences.sCn: 即便没有高中文凭，一个黑人只要有求职意愿，他仍可能找到工作，并且水管工和电缆维修员这类体力活，薪酬还挺不错。

words.tran: 探究；垂直悬挂；用铅锤测量；灌铅以增重（plumb的现在分词）

trans.tranOther: someone whose job is to repair water pipes, baths, toilets etc
